title: Distance Education Program Design for Elementary and Secondary Mathematics Teachers: Interactive Mathematical Activities and Digital Assessment Tools Development

context.prior_knowledge: Three or more years of mathematics instruction experience, basic digital literacy, systematic understanding of mathematical formulas, terminology, and problem types (calculation-proof-application), and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Enhances remote teaching design competencies for in-service K-12 math teachers applicable to real classrooms. Focuses on visualizing math concepts (graph/geometry modeling) in digital environments, probability/statistics-based assessments (distribution analysis/inference), and improving problem-solving skills across types (computational, proof, applied, creative).

learning_goals: Analyze a remote mathematics instruction framework tailored to adult learners with over 90% accuracy, and explore methods to effectively convey core mathematical concepts (equations, functions, geometry) through formulas, graphs, and proof processes.
Develop at least three interactive mathematics activities in a real-time online environment, such as graph-generating tools, dynamic simulations, and collaborative problem-solving exercises.
Design formative assessment tools (e.g., automated grading systems, probability distribution analyzers, statistical report generators) using digital tools and apply them to actual classes.

Develop a rubric for evaluating the effectiveness of remote education programs, comprehensively assessing learning objective achievement, problem-solving skills, statistical analysis capabilities, and proof-writing proficiency.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
